text.p: Guatemala exported 647,152 tonnes of sugar from November 1 to May 6, the Central American Isthmus Sugar Producers said on Thursday.
The exports cover the period of Guatemala's 1996-97 sugar harvest, and was 6.3 percent below sugar exports for the same period of 690,608 tonnes.
Of the total exports, refined and white sugar exports accounted for 213,514 tonnes and raw sugar 433,638 tonnes.
According to the report, the United States was the largest customer for Guatemalan sugar exports. Under the quota system, 59,015 tonnes of raw sugar were exported to the United States.
Guatemala imported and re-exported an additional 123,333 tonnes of raw sugar and 11,600 bulk white sugar to the United States, it added.

Other destinations include 98,900 tonnes refined sugar to Chile; 108,990 tonnes raw sugar to Morocco; 57,700 tonnes to Sri Lanka, 14,000 raws, 43,700 refined and white; 49,000 tonnes raw sugar to Canada; 38,000 tonnes to the Ivory Coast, 24,000 raw and 14,000 white; 36,000 raw sugar to Mexico; and smaller quantities to Haiti, Jamaica, Peru, Lithuania and Yemen.
